story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething at the count for the Senedd elections iltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgtn the House of Sportltspan classtruncate-full-screengt, Cardf today.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething with his son and we celebrating afterltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt winning Cardf Soultspan classtruncate-full-screengtth and Penarth during the count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething celebrating after winning Cardf Southltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt and Penarth during ltspan classtruncate-full-screengtthe count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentVAUGHAN Gething has retained his seat in the Senedd.Mr Gething, who has represented Cardf South and Penarth since , has secured his seat by a majority of more than , votes.The Labour representative received , votes."Im delighted with the result," he said."A really strong showing across Cardf South and Penarth. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. for South Wales Central.. - Senedd Election Count in Barry -Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after bltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgteing elected to the ltspan Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Watch: Senedd Election : Meet the new MSs for South Wales CentralAndrew RT Davies" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: expect prime ministers latest announcement
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySo what will people in England be able to do from May  ndash Which outdoor activities will be allowed As summer approaches, the Government has pledged to look at easing restrictions on outdoor gatherings up to a legal limit of  people.This means Mr Johnson is likely to say people are free to meet friends and family in parks, gardens and other outdoor areas.The Governmentrsquos road map advises people to ldquodecide on the appropriate level of risk for their circumstances when arranging to meet.ndash What will be allowed indoors Gatherings inside homes are likely to be allowed once again, with a limit of up to six people or groups from a maximum of two households.Ato indoor pubs, cinemas and sports is also on the cards ndash and this time without any pm curfews. vw,vw,px, px"The Prime Minister is expected to say revellers will be able to enjoy a pint inside pubs from May  Pub-goers will also be free to meet for a pint without having to buy a substantial meal, but they must order, eat and drink while seated to avoid queues at the bar.ndash How are social contact rules changing Mr Johnson is expected to update the advice on social distancing to allow more intimate contact with relatives and friends.In a nod towards hugging being allowed once again, cabinet minister Michael Gove told Sky News on Sunday that ldquointimate contact between friends and family is something we want to see restored.The Government will also be reviewing wider social-distancing policies which are in place to reduce coronavirus transmission, including the two-metre rule and mandatory face coverings on transport and in other public places.     ndash What does this mean for businesses In a huge boon for the hospitality sector, the Prime Minister is expected to say that most businesses in all but the highest risk areas will be able to reopen.Business owners must follow Covid safety guidelines including making sure they do not cater for groups beyond the legal limits.ndash What about live events In addition to funerals, up to  people will be able to join together to celebrate weddings, receptions, wakes and religious ceremonies like bar mitzvahs and christenings.May  is also likely to herald ato theatres and indoor sporting arenas, with a maximum capacity of , people.Outdoor arenas will be able to host live events with a maximum number of , attendees, or for large outdoor seated venues where crowds can be spread out, up to ,.ndash Will employees be ing to their offices As part of the Governmentrsquos review into longer-term social-distancing policies, the working from home message may also be scrapped.This may not come into effect on May , but is expected before the following phase easings on June .ndash Is it safe to book foreign holidays The Prime Minister has previously announced that Britons will be allowed to travel to green list countries without having to quarantine, providing they take one post-arrival test.Portugal, Gibraltar, Israel, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Brunei, Iceland and the Faroe Islands ndash plus several small remote islands which are British Overseas Territories are currently on this list.However, entry to Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Brunei and the Faroe Islands is severely restricted.Hotels, hostels and BBs in England will be allowed to take group bookings, meaning people can more easily plan domestic holidays..push,i[r].l*new title: ireland steps lockdown
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityA phased reopening of non-essential retail will begin, with click-and-collect services and in-store shopping by appointment allowed, while close contact services, such as hairdressers, can resume.Restrictions on inter-county travel have also lted while some of the limitations on indoor and outdoor social gatherings have eased.Many museums, galleries and libraries are now able to reopen and the number of people allowed to attend religious services, including weddings and funerals, has increased to .Indoor wedding receptions will be capped at six people and  for outdoor celebrations.Three households, or up to six people from inidual households, can now meet outdoors, including in private gardens.Vaccinated households can also meet with an unvaccinated household indoorsprovided they are not at risk of severe illness and there are no more than three households present.This measure will enable grandparents to meet and hug other family members indoors.Three vaccinated households are also allowed to meet indoors .Team sports training for adults in pods of  is also now permitted. vw,vw,px, px"Taoiseach Micheal Martin has expressed hope that Ireland is leaving behind lockdown restrictions Allowed capacity on public transport has also increased to %.Next Monday retail will reopen fully, with a iety of other restrictions due to lt in June.On Sunday, Taoiseach Micheal Martin expressed hope that Ireland could look forward to a good summer.Mr Martin was commenting after he received an AstraZeneca vaccine in Cork.ldquoI think wersquore making great progress as a country, he said.ldquoI think people have done extremely well in responding to the ious guidelines over the last number of months and the results are that we are emerging from this pandemic.     ldquoWersquore set to have a good summerwe can keep this progress going and the vaccination is certainly helping in bring down severe illness and bringing down death and hospitalisation, so keep with it and wersquore making progress.Irelandrsquos vaccination programme continues to gather pace and on Friday the country achieved a record for the number of jabs administered in one day, ,..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Ireland steps further out of lockdown article_url title: queens speech feature planning system overhaul   report
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityConservative leaders believe the number of people who owned their homes was the key to the partyrsquos gains in last weekrsquos local elections, according to the Times.Labour received a drubbing in some parts of the country, losing control of a host of councils and suffering defeat at the hands of Boris Johnsonrsquos Conservatives in Hartlepool, with the North East constituency electing a Tory MP for the first time since .The party also lost control of Durham council for the first time in a century, saw its local leader deposed by the Greens in Sheffield and witnessed heavy defeats in Rotherham and Sunderland authorities.According to the paper, the planning bill is aimed at expanding the rates of home ownership across small cities and towns in areas which have historically voted Labour.The reforms will reportedly simply the planning process to make it more dficult for existing homeowners to block new housing schemes, with the country to be ided into ldquogrowth or ldquoprotection zones. vw,vw,px, px"Prime Minister Boris Johnson in front of a giant inflatable of himself as he celebrates the Conservative partyrsquos victory in the Hartlepool parliamentary by-election It is believed automatic planning approval will be given to homes, hospitals, schools, shops and offices in growth areas, while development in protected areas will be restricted but not ruled out.The Times also reported the Government is set to trial a ldquofirst homes scheme in the former Labour bastion of Bolsover, Derbyshire, which will give discounts of at least  per cent to first-time buyers in their local area.The Queenrsquos Speech may also feature a long-awaited overhaul of the social care sector, with Cabinet Office minister Michael Goversquos prediction of having the reforms passing through Parliament within the next seven months a possible indication the proposals could make it into Tuesdayrsquos announcement.     Mr Gove,asked whether the social care overhaul would form part of the Queenrsquos Speech, told Times Radio: ldquoWersquore working to make sure that we have an effective social care plan at the moment. That work is going on.ldquoSo, by the end of the year you will have a specic social care plan that is heading for the statute books at the very least.ldquoWe want to make sure that we can get cross-party support for it. That is critical.ldquoThatrsquos the point the Prime Minister has always made. The more support we can get for it across parties, and I hope we do, the quicker we can be.Labour shadow health secretary Jonathan Ashworth said: ldquoThe test of whether this Queenrsquos Speech genuinely delivers for the people of Britain isit brings forward a proper rescue plan for the NHS and delivers a social care solution as Boris Johnson promised on the steps of Downing Street almost two years ago.Downing Street has signalled that the Queenrsquos Speech on May  ndash when the monarch sets out the Governmentrsquos legislative agenda ndash will place renewed emphasis on Mr Johnsonrsquos ambitions to ldquolevel up.Officials said as well as supporting the nationrsquos recovery from Covid- and backing the NHS, the speech will include draft laws designed to ldquospread opportunity across the UK. vw,vw,px, px"Downing Street said the Queenrsquos Speech will focus on Boris Johnsonrsquos aim of lsquospreading opportunitiesrsquo Downing Street has confirmed its programme, due to be revealed during the State Opening of Parliament, will see theof both the controversial Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill and the Environment Bill, which they said will set legally binding environmental targets in the run-up to the international Cop summit in Glasgow later this year.The former Bill was shelved during the last parliamentary session after it sparked violent protests in some places across the UK.If approved, it would hand greater power to police in England and Wales to shut down protests deemed overly noisy or disruptive, with those convicted liable to fines or jail terms.Usually one of the most colourful events of the parliamentary year, the Queenrsquos Speech this year will be a scaled-back affair due to coronavirus restrictions.The visit of the Queen to the Palace of Westminster will see signicantly fewer MPs and peers, a reduced royal procession into the House of Lords where the speech is given from and no diplomatic or non-parliamentary guests to be permitted..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Queen us Speech to feature planning system overhaul  u report article_url   content_id
